intro: Schoepfia stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf schoepfia, is a perennial shrub native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open woodlands. Schoepfia stenophylla is valued for its ornamental foliage and its ability to withstand drought conditions.
